title: Omni-Router: Sharing Routing Decisions in Sparse Mixture-of-Experts for Speech Recognition
author: Zijin Gu (Apple Inc.), Tatiana Likhomanenko (Apple Inc.), Navdeep Jaitly (Apple Inc.)
relevance_why: The research explores a novel routing mechanism in Mixture-of-Experts architectures that improves Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR), a critical area of Haohe Liu's research in audio and speech processing.
background: Developing a new model architecture that shares routing decisions among layers in a Mixture-of-Experts setup to enhance the performance of speech recognition systems.
contribution: The paper introduces the Omni-router Transformer to solve the lack of coordination in expert routing across layers, achieving a significant reduction in word error rates by up to 11.2% compared to existing models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous Mixture-of-Experts methods operated with independent routing mechanisms in each layer, leading to weak correlations between layers.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work shares routing weights across layers, ensuring coordinated decision-making and structured expert usage, resulting in improved ASR accuracy.

key_innovation: Employs a shared router mechanism that ensures layers coordinate their expert selections, which enhances specialization across diverse speech data.
real_world_impact: This method could significantly improve the robustness and efficiency of ASR systems, potentially benefiting applications in voice assistants, transcription services, and multilingual speech recognition.

new_terms.Omni-router Transformer: **Omni-router Transformer** refers to a model architecture that utilizes a shared routing mechanism across multiple layers to improve expert selection decisions in Mixture-of-Experts frameworks.
